FuncDef: The pki certificate access-control-policy rule command arranges rules in a certificate access policy. The pki certificate access-control-policy rule command arranges rules in a certificate access policy.
CLIs: pki certificate access-control-policy [ policy-name <policy-name> ] rulemove <rule-id1> { after | before } <rule-id2>

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a certificate access policy. If the policy-name parameter is not specified, the default certificate access policy uses the name default-0.
The value must be an existing certificate access policy name.

Changes the sequence of rule-id1 and rule-id2.
The values must be existing certificate access policy numbers.

Changes the sequence of rule-id1 and rule-id2.
The values must be existing certificate access policy numbers.

Examples: [~HUAWEI] pki certificate access-control-policy policy-name a rule move 20 before 5
ExtraInfo: If multiple control rules are configured in an access control policy based on certificate attributes, the relationship between the rules is "Or". This means that the action defined in the access control policy is implemented as long as the certificate to be authenticated matches one rule. The remaining control rules are not used. You can run this command to adjust rule sequence so that the rule you prefer can take effect first.
